procedures.name: Venipuncture
procedures.label: Blood Draw
procedures.description: Collection of blood samples for laboratory analysis including PK, PD, and safety assessments

code.decode: Collection of venous blood by venipuncture

procedures.name: Insulin-induced Hypoglycemia
procedures.label: Hypoglycemia Induction
procedures.description: Procedure to induce hypoglycemia using IV insulin infusion targeting nadir glucose around 50 mg/dL, stopped once bedside PG reaches <60 mg/dL

procedures.name: Nasal Glucagon Administration
procedures.label: Nasal LY900018 Administration
procedures.description: Administration of 3 mg LY900018 nasal glucagon powder through nasal dosing device approximately 5 minutes after insulin infusion stop

procedures.name: Intramuscular Glucagon Administration
procedures.label: IMG Administration
procedures.description: Administration of 1 mg intramuscular glucagon (GlucaGen) after reconstitution

code.decode: Therapeutic, prophylactic, or diagnostic injection; subcutaneous or intramuscular

procedures.name: Bedside Plasma Glucose Monitoring
procedures.label: Bedside PG Monitoring
procedures.description: Safety monitoring of plasma glucose during hypoglycemia induction and post study treatment up to 120 mins, conducted no more than 10 minutes apart when PG ≥90 mg/dL and no more than 5 minutes apart when PG <90 mg/dL

procedures.name: 12-lead Electrocardiogram
procedures.label: ECG
procedures.description: Single 12-lead ECG performed locally at screening and follow-up; triplicate 12-lead ECG performed centrally at multiple time points during treatment periods

code.decode: Electrocardiogram, routine ECG with at least 12 leads

procedures.name: Vital Signs Measurement
procedures.label: Vital Signs
procedures.description: Measurement of supine blood pressure, pulse rate, and body temperature at screening, pre-hypoglycemia induction, predose, and at 15, 30, 60, 120, 240 minutes post-dose

procedures.name: Height and Weight Measurement
procedures.label: Height and Weight
procedures.description: Height measured at screening only; weight collected on Day 1 before the start of the procedure to induce hypoglycemia

procedures.name: Clinical Laboratory Tests
procedures.label: Lab Tests
procedures.description: Hematology, clinical chemistry, and urinalysis performed at screening, pre-hypoglycemia induction in each period, and follow-up

procedures.name: Clinical Serology Tests
procedures.label: Serology
procedures.description: Serology testing performed at screening

procedures.name: HbA1c Test
procedures.label: HbA1c
procedures.description: Hemoglobin A1c measurement at screening and pre-hypoglycemia induction

procedures.name: Pregnancy Test
procedures.label: Pregnancy Test
procedures.description: Serum pregnancy test at screening; urine pregnancy test at every admission period and follow-up visit for female patients of childbearing potential

procedures.name: FSH Test
procedures.label: FSH
procedures.description: Follicle-stimulating hormone test for female patients when needed to confirm postmenopausal status

procedures.name: Ethanol Testing
procedures.label: Ethanol Test
procedures.description: Ethanol testing at Day -1 of Period 1, additional tests at discretion of investigator

procedures.name: Urine Drug Screen
procedures.label: Drug Screen
procedures.description: Urine drug screening at Day -1 of Period 1, additional tests at discretion of investigator

procedures.name: Pharmacokinetic Blood Sampling
procedures.label: PK Sampling
procedures.description: Blood sampling for glucagon PK at pre-hypoglycemia induction, predose, 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 40, 50, 60, 90, 120, 240 minutes post-dose

code.decode: Collection of venous blood by venipuncture

procedures.name: Pharmacodynamic Blood Sampling
procedures.label: PD Sampling
procedures.description: Blood sampling for plasma glucose PD at pre-hypoglycemia induction, -5, predose, 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 40, 50, 60, 90, 120, 240 minutes post-dose

code.decode: Collection of venous blood by venipuncture

procedures.name: Genetic Sample Collection
procedures.label: Genetic Sample
procedures.description: Single sample for pharmacogenetic analysis taken prior to or on Period 1 Day -1

code.decode: Collection of venous blood by venipuncture

procedures.name: Immunogenicity Sample Collection
procedures.label: ADA Sampling
procedures.description: Blood sampling for anti-drug antibodies at screening, pre-hypoglycemia induction in each period, and follow-up; additional follow-up every 12 weeks for treatment-emergent ADA

code.decode: Collection of venous blood by venipuncture

procedures.name: Injection-Site Assessment
procedures.label: Injection Site Assessment
procedures.description: Assessment of injection site for IMG only at pre-hypoglycemia induction and 90 minutes post-dose

procedures.name: Nasal Inspection
procedures.label: Nasal Inspection
procedures.description: Nasal inspection for both IMG and LY900018 at pre-hypoglycemia induction and 90 minutes post-dose

procedures.name: Edinburgh Hypoglycemia Scale Assessment
procedures.label: Hypoglycemia Symptoms Questionnaire
procedures.description: Assessment of hypoglycemia symptoms at pre-hypoglycemia induction, during hypoglycemia induction (when PG ≤75 mg/dL), predose, 15, 30, 60, 120 minutes post-dose

procedures.name: Physical Examination
procedures.label: Physical Exam
procedures.description: Physical examination performed at screening to assess eligibility

code.decode: Office or other outpatient visit, new patient

procedures.name: Intravenous Glucose Administration
procedures.label: IV Glucose
procedures.description: IV glucose administered if patient experiences signs and symptoms of severe hypoglycemia requiring intervention during experimental procedure

procedures.name: Carbohydrate-Rich Meal Administration
procedures.label: Meal
procedures.description: Carbohydrate-rich meal provided after completion of all PK sampling; investigator ensures patient's PG is stable

medicalDevices.name: Nasal Dosing Device
medicalDevices.label: LY900018 Nasal Device
medicalDevices.description: User-friendly, single-use, nasal dosing device that delivers 3 mg glucagon powder for absorption through the nasal mucosa without requiring patient inhalation

medicalDevices.name: Infusion Pump
medicalDevices.label: IV Insulin Infusion Pump
medicalDevices.description: Device used for intravenous insulin infusion to induce hypoglycemia

medicalDevices.name: Bedside Glucose Monitor
medicalDevices.label: Bedside PG Monitor
medicalDevices.description: Device for bedside plasma glucose monitoring during hypoglycemia induction and post-treatment safety monitoring

medicalDevices.name: 12-lead ECG Device
medicalDevices.label: ECG Device
medicalDevices.description: Device for recording 12-lead electrocardiograms, both single (local) and triplicate (central) measurements

medicalDevices.name: Continuous Subcutaneous Insulin Infusion Pump
medicalDevices.label: CSII Pump
medicalDevices.description: Insulin pump used by patients with T1DM or T2DM for continuous subcutaneous insulin infusion therapy

medicalDevices.name: Syringe for Intramuscular Injection
medicalDevices.label: IM Injection Syringe
medicalDevices.description: Syringe used for intramuscular administration of reconstituted glucagon (GlucaGen)
